definition: to cut staff/to lay off employees
to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: The week began with forecasts of huge public-sector job losses.
sentences.chinese: 这个礼拜一开始就有传言，说要大量裁员。

sentences.english: An arbitral tribunal shall be normally made up of three arbitrators .
sentences.chinese: 仲裁庭一般由三名仲裁员组成。
分析家预测银行将裁员二十万。

sentences.english: Article 20 A labor dispute arbitration commission shall have a roster of arbitrators.
sentences.chinese: 第二十条劳动争议仲裁委员会应当设仲裁员名册。

sentences.english: The employees, mostly young, listened to the cutbacks that were coming.
sentences.chinese: 那些职员大多是年轻人，听着公司即将裁员的消息。

sentences.english: "I spent the last five years of my career downsizing," he said.
sentences.chinese: “我在朗讯的最后五年一直在负责裁员，”他说。

sentences.english: An arbitration commission shall have a register of arbitrators in different specializations.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁委员会按照不同专业设仲裁员名册。

sentences.english: Mr. Jones was the first casualty of the firm's cut - backs.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯先生在公司裁员中是第一个受害者。

sentences.english: They’re downsizing, and I got my walking papers last week.
sentences.chinese: 公司裁员，我于上周收到了解聘书。

sentences.english: Inamori did not confirm that number Monday.
sentences.chinese: 稻盛和夫星期一没有证实裁员的规模。

sentences.english: The arbitrator legal liability system has deep rationale.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁员法律责任制度具有深厚的理论基础。

sentences.english: Questions about the ethics of downsizing are sure to continue.
sentences.chinese: 有关裁员的道德问题肯定会不断出现。

sentences.english: We might see another wave of retrenchments later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 今年迟些时候可能出现另一波的裁员现象。

sentences.english: Workers will go on a "last in, first out" basis.
sentences.chinese: 对工人的裁员原则是羚“后进先出”。

sentences.english: These negative side effects only add more weight to HSBC's challenges.
sentences.chinese: 裁员的负面效应使汇丰银行面临的挑战更加严峻。

sentences.english: The three arbitrators so appointed will from an arbitration tribunal to hear the case.
sentences.chinese: 由这样指定的三位仲裁员组成仲裁庭来审理案件。

definition: to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
sacking the worst-performing employee/elimination of the worst-performing contestant
to shut down (a factory)/to close a facility/a lockout
executive/senior management/(contraction of 高級管理|高级管理)
to invite applications for a job/to recruit
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
